title: Sports Corner: Announcements
text:
Comments 
Calaveras Cancer Support Group softball tournament 
The Calaveras Cancer Support Group will hold its 2015 softball tournament on Oct. 4 at Copello Park in Angels Camp with opening ceremonies at 8 a.m. The tournament this year benefits Staci Santella. Entry is $300 per team, plus two raffle prizes. There will be a snack bar and prizes raffled away at the tournament. Volunteers are needed. For more, call 743-6262. 
Valley Springs Elementary Bulldog Classic golf tournament 
La Contenta Golf Course hosts the second annual Valley Springs Elementary Bulldog Classic tournament on Oct. 9. Registration is at 8:30 a.m. and play begins at 9 a.m. with a shotgun start. Fees are $110 per player or $400 per foursome, including green fees, carts and lunch. Dinner-only tickets are $25. The first 10 foursomes to pay receive licensed polo shirts with their welcome packages. Registration must be completed by Sept. 25. For more, contact Jessica Hughart at 204-8346 or jessica@lacontentagolf.com . 
Murphys Area Community Tennis Association tournament 
The Murphys Area Community Tennis Association (MACTA) is holding a mixed doubles tennis tournament on Oct. 10 at Bret Harte High School and the Murphys Wintercreek facility. The doubles tournament will be two flights, and is for all levels of ability. Players may sign up individually and teams will be paired as per ability. Registration is $20 per player, plus one can of tennis balls. The facility of play will be assigned to each player prior to Oct. 10. There is an 8 a.m. check-in for the tournament and food and beverages will be available for purchase at each location. For more information, contact Jim Triolo at 795-3183 or mario22@prodigy.net . 
CAST for Kids Fishing Fun Fair 
The Catch a Special Thrill event brings children ages 5 to 16 who are disabled or disadvantaged together with volunteers who introduce them to the fun of fishing on Oct. 10 at the New Melones Lake Visitors Center on Studhorse Flat Road, off Highway 49 just south of the Stevenot Bridge. Kids get to fish from the shore and from boats and enjoy a barbecue lunch, free T-shirts, water safety workshops and more. Volunteers and participants register at castforkids.org/events-calendar/cast-events/lake-new-melones . For more, call U.S. Bureau of Reclamation Ranger Mike McGraw at 536-9094 ext. 233. 
AMA car raffle 
AMA Youth Sports is raffling off a 2015 Subaru Impreza, provided by Sonora Subaru, to support its various sports programs. The Subaru will be on display outside of several businesses around the Angels Camp area. Tickets are $100 each and a maximum of 400 will be sold. One entry will be drawn as the winner at the 2015 Mother Lode Valley Football League Super Bowl at Bret Harte High School Nov. 7. To purchase a ticket, go to amayouthsports.com or call Bob Barnett at 736-0334. 
CYBA registrations 
The Calaveras Youth Basketball Association will be hosting 2015-16 basketball registrations for all players, and skills evaluations for new players, from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. on Nov. 7 and 14 at the Toyon Middle School gymnasium. It is not necessary to come to both. Skills evaluations are mandatory only for players that did not play last year. Registration is open to all boys and girls ages 6 through 14. Registration cost is $50 per child on these registration dates, or $60 per child after Nov. 14. Registrations for the season close on Dec. 4. CYBA practices and games will be held on Saturdays in San Andreas and the season runs from January to March. Registration forms will be available at Toyon on Nov. 7 and 14, or you can obtain them at cyba.weebly.com . For more information, contact Jerry Gaspers at 601-1171. 
Basketball training sessions 
The Calaveras High girls basketball program is offering individual basketball training sessions for youth basketball players looking to improve a specific skill or their overall game. These sessions offer players of all ages and abilities the chance to work one-on-one with members of the CHS coaching staff and players. Sessions will be individually tailored to fit each playerâ€™s needs and schedule. Cost is $25 for hour-long individual sessions or $30 for two players. Email ladyredshoops@gmail.com or call 217-4563 for more information or to schedule a session. 
4-H seeks shooting sports volunteers 
The Calaveras 4-H Youth Development Program is looking for adults who would like to become certified shooting sports volunteer leaders. There are several trainings that occur during the year, throughout the state in disciplines such as rifle, shotgun, archery and pistol. All shooting sports instructors must complete the program certification. For more information, please contact the Calaveras UCCE/4-H office at 754-6474. 
2015 Bret Harte Aquatic Masters 
The Bret Harte Aquatic Masters swim season is underway and ends in mid-November. One-hour practices are held on Mondays at 6:15 a.m. and 5:30 p.m., Tuesdays at 6 a.m., Wednesdays at 6 a.m., 1:45 p.m. and 5:30 p.m., Thursdays at 6 a.m., Fridays at 6:15 a.m. and 1:45 p.m., and Saturdays at 8 a.m. at the Bret Harte Aquatic Center off of Murphys Grade Road in Angels Camp. Membership fees are $65 a month with full-season membership commitments, $70 a month for partial season memberships, $20 a week for 30-day trial swimmers and $15 for daily drop-in swimmers. Anyone ages 18 or older who wants to learn, improve strokes, get ready for big races or just have fun is welcome. To sign up, go to usms.org/reg/register.php and make sure you are in the Pacific Zone and then under BHAM. For more information, contact Christy Alford at 795-8131 or at christyalford@msn.com . 
Yoga in Mountain Ranch 
Yoga is offered at the Mountain Ranch Youth Center from 9 to 11 a.m. Wednesdays with instructor Kristine Louise. Cost is a $5 instructor fee and $2 donation to the center. For more, visit mountainranchresourcecenter.com or call 754-4073. 
Sports Corner announcements are published free of charge in as many issues as possible. Announcements are also published online at calaverasenterprise.com . Send announcements to sports@calaverasenterprise.com . Tags
